special_cp.overview: Poliwrath's has 2923 max CP (at Level 50). A Poliwrath obtained from Raids can be encountered from 1405 CP to 1477 CP, or if weather boosted, in the 1757 CP to 1847 CP range. In Field and Special Research, Poliwrath can be found in the 1054 CP to 1108 CP range.
more_info: Field and Special Research encounters are always Level 15. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Field Research encounters have a 10/10/10 IV floor.
Pok√©mon hatched from Eggs are always Level 20. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Egg Hatches have a 10/10/10 IV floor.
Raid Bosses caught without weather boost are always Level 20. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Raid Catches have a 10/10/10 IV floor. üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.

Raid Bosses caught with weather boost are always Level 25. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Weather boosted Raid Catches have a 10/10/10 IV floor. üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
Wild encounters range from Level 1 to Level 30 Pok√©mon. Their IVs range from 0 (min) to 15 (max) for each stat.

Weather Boosted wild Pok√©mon encounters get a 5 Level boost, bringing their Level range to Level 6 to Level 35. In addition, they have a guaraneed minimum IV value of 4 for each stat, resulting in a 4/4/4 IV floor.

meta_analysis: Poliwrath in the meta PvE Analysis ‚öîÔ∏è Raids Poliwrath is a Pok√©mon with balanced stats, leaning more toward bulk, which makes it underwhelming as a raid attacker. In raids, you benefit more from Pok√©mon that deal big damage in the smallest amount of time possible, and with its best DPS being 12.13, Poliwrath is not one of them. Nevertheless, as a Fighting -type raid attacker, Poliwrath prefers using Counter and Dynamic Punch , and is strong against Normal , Rock , Ice , Steel , and Dark types. As a Water -type raid attacker, Poliwrath makes use of Bubble and Hydro Pump , being strong against Pok√©mon weak to Water -type moves. However, it‚Äôs worth noting that there are better-performing options in either type category, making Poliwrath as a raid attacker potentially not worth the investment. üîÆ Dynamax N/A Show more Show less PvP Analysis üîµ Great League Poliwrath was actually one of the best Fighting -type Pok√©mon in the Great League for a while. It had access to both Counter and Scald , two of the best moves at that time. However, we now live in a reality where both moves have been rebalanced. Nevertheless, Poliwrath is still a decent pick for the Great League . Its balanced stats, which make it undesirable as a raid attacker, work to its benefit here. Poliwrath is just bulky enough to survive a few hits while dishing out good damage itself. It also has access to Icy Wind to debuff the opponent‚Äôs attack stat and further increase its survivability. üü° Ultra League Much of the same applies to the Ultra League as well. In fact, Poliwrath works even better here as it can take down some high-profile opponents such as Guzzlord , Lickilicky , Greninja , and Registeel . üü£ Master League Poliwrath , being a Pok√©mon with a Max CP of 2923, just cannot compete in the legendary-dominated Master League , where the meta is ruled by Pok√©mon with very high stats. mega_boost.title: Mega Pok√©mon that boost Poliwrath
mega_boost.intro_text: A list of Mega Pok√©mon that boost Poliwrath's Water and Fighting-type moves, Candy, and Candy XL from catching Poliwrath.

bonus_info.raid_bonus: Mega and Primal Raid Bonus ‚Äì Mega Pok√©mon boost the attack power of all other Pok√©mon when battling in Raid Battles by 10%. Attacks that share their type with the Mega Pok√©mon's type(s) receive a 30% boost. However, these bonuses do not stack if there are multiple Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon battling simultaneously; only the higher boost will be applied.
bonus_info.catch_bonus: Mega and Primal Catch Bonus ‚Äì While a Pok√©mon is Mega-Evolved, additional XP and Candy is granted when catching a Pok√©mon that shares a type with it, or for any raid boss caught. These do not stack with each other. Additionally, High and Max Level Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon grant an increased chance to obtain Candy XL when catching a Pok√©mon that shares a type with it.

size_info.description: Poliwrath's height ranges from 0.64 m to 2.28 m, with the average being 1.3 m. The illustration shows a comparison with a 1.70 m (5‚Ä≤07‚Ä≥) tall Trainer. Max height has been limited to 450px for rendering purposes.

pokedex.entry: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breast stroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.
Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its body. It can even overtake champion swimmers.
This strong and skilled swimmer is even capable of crossing the Pacific Ocean just by kicking.
Although an ener getic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its mus cles, it lives on dry land.
It can use its well-developed arms and legs to run on the surface of the water for a split second.

POLIWRATH‚Äôs highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this POK√©MON can swim back and forth across the Pacific Ocean without effort.
Its highly developed muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. This POK√©MON can swim back and forth across the Pacific Ocean without effort.
An adept swimmer, it knows the front crawl, butterfly, and more. It is faster than the best human swimmers.
A swimmer adept at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.
With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
This strong and skilled swimmer is even capable of crossing the Pacific Ocean just by kicking.
Although an energetic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its muscles, it lives on dry land.
With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
A swimmer adept at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.
Poliwrath‚Äôs highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this Pok√©mon can swim back and forth across the ocean without effort.
Poliwrath in the Alola region are strong swimmers that use the breaststroke. Many children learn to swim by imitating Poliwrath.
Its percentage of body fat is nearly zero. Its body is entirely muscle, which makes it heavy and forces its swimming prowess to develop.
It‚Äôs quite a gifted swimmer, even among Water-type Pok√©mon, but it normally spends its time on land.
The muscles it has developed through swimming are thick and powerful. When it lands a square punch, it can turn huge boulders to dust.
Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its body. It can even overtake world-class swimmers.
Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.
Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.

faq.question: What are Poliwrath‚Äôs strengths and weaknesses?
faq.answer: As a Water and Fighting-type Pok√©mon, Poliwrath is weak to Electric, Fairy, Flying, Grass, and Psychic-type moves.

faq.question: What are the best moves for Poliwrath in Pok√©mon GO?
faq.answer: The best moves for Poliwrath in Pok√©mon GO are Counter and Dynamic Punch. This moveset has a DPS (Damage Per Second) of 10.91 and a TDO (Total Damage Output) of 224.662.

faq.question: How does Poliwrath perform in Raids?
faq.answer: Poliwrath's Raid attacker tier is currently not known, has no viable moves, or it is too low to be ranked.

faq.question: How does Poliwrath rank as a Water-type attacker?
faq.answer: Poliwrath is an F-Tier Water-type attacker and not recommended for Raid battles.

faq.question: How does Poliwrath rank as a Fighting-type attacker?
faq.answer: Poliwrath is an F-Tier Fighting-type attacker and not recommended for Raid battles.

faq.question: What Mega Pok√©mon boost Poliwrath?
faq.answer: The following Mega Pok√©mon boost Poliwrath: Mega Blastoise, Mega Slowbro, Mega Gyarados, Mega Swampert, Mega Sharpedo, Primal Kyogre, Mega Heracross, Mega Blaziken, Mega Medicham, Mega Lopunny, Mega Lucario, and Mega Gallade.
